column4: I just recieved my dell inspiron 1525, first time running ubuntu (or linux for that matter). I was wondering if there is a way to add larger resolutions in system->preferences->screen resolution
oh, that might be as high as your screen can handle
you can always just edit your theme to make stuff smaller
i'm not sure, but i have a dell inspiron e1505 laptop and 1280x800 is the highest it goes
has anybody in here ever seen an error displayed when trying to hibernate that says *ERROR* pat entry 2 is already configured ?
daisuke_Ido: the look, the feel of cotton? the fabric of our lives?
why, everytime I launch add/remove applications, does it say that my list of applications is out of date?
if I launch it now, update it, close it, then relaunch it right away it says the same thing

algorithmicContr: the version of firefox that comes with hardy is the newest beta, there are still a lot of extentions that aren't compatible with it, if you are the tweaking and hacking adventuresom sort i can find an article i read that tells you how you can get a lot of them to work anyway...
usually when you add new repos, it makes you update, but i have no idea why it would keep saying it after you update
